questions.q: What kind of diversity is represented in the deck?
questions.a:
The Hermetic Flight intentionally features diverse representation across:

  • Body types and sizes (aerial arts welcomes all bodies)
  • Ages (from 20s through 50s+)
  • Ethnicities and skin tones
  • Gender presentations
  • Abilities

This wasn't tokenistic—aerial communities are genuinely diverse, and we documented that reality. Tarot speaks to all humans; the imagery should reflect that.

questions.q: Did you rename any Major Arcana cards?
questions.a:
No. All Major Arcana retain their traditional names (The Fool, The Magician, The High Priestess, etc.). We believe radical renaming creates unnecessary confusion and can indicate an oracle deck rather than a true tarot deck.

However, our interpretations honor both traditional and modern understandings—for example, The Devil addresses both shadow work and systemic oppression, and Death explores transformation beyond the individual level.
